text: Cem Özdemir (, ; born 21 December 1965) is a German politician of the party Alliance 90/The Greens who has been the Minister of Food and Agriculture since 2021. Between 2008 and 2018, Özdemir was one of two main persons of the Green Party, together with Claudia Roth and later Simone Peter. He has been a Member of the German Bundestag since 2013. He was a Member of the German Bundestag in 1994–2002 too. He was a member of the European Parliament in 2004–2009 too. He was a one of two main Greens candidates for the 2017 German federal election. Since 2018, he has been the Leader of the Committee on Transport. On December 16, 2020, he undertook support for Katsyaryna Barysevich, Belarusian political prisoner. On May 31, 2021, he undertook support for Roman Protasevich, Belarusian political prisoner. == Awards == * 2018 – Ramer Award for Courage in the Defense of DemocracyElisabeth Binder (12 October 2018), American Jewish Committee in Berlin: Kritische Fragen zum Geburtstag Der Tagesspiegel. * 2011 – Foreign Policy List of Top Global Thinkers * 2009 – Honorary doctorate of the Tunceli University * 1996 – Theodor Heuss Medal == Books == * Currywurst und Döner – Integration in Deutschland * Ich bin Inländer (autobiography) * Die Türkei: Politik, Religion, Kultur == References == == Other websites == * Category:1965 births Category:Living people Category:Members of the German Bundestag Category:MEPs for Germany Category:Agriculture ministers of Germany Category:Politicians of Alliance '90/The Greens Category:Politicians from Baden-Württemberg
title: Cem Özdemir
